channel.title: How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?
channel.description: I try to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix on Windows Whonix Workstation. For this I set on my Windows 7 VirtualBox machine the following network settings: Address 10.152.152.18 netmask 255.255.192.0 gateway 10.152.152.10 nameserver 10.152.152.10 And this Workstation perfectly browses on the internet. However, I was unable to ping any site via command line on this machine. Also, I installed and configured WG client properly, but couldn't connect to my VPN server through Whonix. How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?

item.title: How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?
item.dc:creator: Armored
item.description:
Hi, Patrick, and thank you very much for your detailed answer. Why didn’t I guess that TOR, being TCP style net, will not work over UDP. I followed your link and found:
www.dds6qkxpwdeubwucdiaord2xgbbeyds25rbsgr73tbfpqpt4a6vjwsyd.onion/wiki/Tunnel_UDP_over_Tor
So possibly in the future Whonix ™ developers will create any tool(s) to combine WG after TOR

Read full topic
item.source: How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?

item.title: How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Armored:

I was unable to ping any site via command line on this machine.

Documented here just now:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Whonix-Workstation_Firewall#ping

Armored:

How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?

On wireguard specifically: undocumented.

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Undocumented / Untested / Unsupported

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Options: Become Contributor / Apply Free Support Principle / Purchase Professional Support.

On VPN generally: See the following introduction documentation.

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Combining Tunnels with Tor

Information on whether Tor gets more or less secure when combining Tor with tunnels such as VPN, SSH, proxies. (User → Tor → proxy/VPN/SSH → Internet) (User → proxy/VPN/SSH → Tor → Internet)

For User → Tor → VPN → Internet tunnel specifically, see:

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Connecting to Tor before a VPN

Instructions on how to connect to Tor before a VPN (User → Tor → VPN → Internet)

One likely cause for the issue could be UDP related:

Note that UDP-style VPN connections are incompatible with Tor; the VPN must be configured to use TCP. [14] To do that, add proto tcp to the VPN configuration file /etc/openvpn/openvpn.conf. Most, but not all VPN providers support this configuration.

Read full topic
item.source: How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?

item.title: How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?
item.dc:creator: Armored
item.description:
I try to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix on Windows Whonix Workstation. For this I set on my Windows 7 VirtualBox machine the following network settings:
Address 10.152.152.18
netmask 255.255.192.0
gateway 10.152.152.10
nameserver 10.152.152.10
And this Workstation perfectly browses on the internet.
However, I was unable to ping any site via command line on this machine. Also, I installed and configured WG client properly, but couldn’t connect to my VPN server through Whonix.
How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?

Read full topic
item.source: How to connect to Wireguard VPN through Whonix?
